org.svvrl.goal.gui
Class UIFileHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.gui.UIFileHandler

public class UIFileHandler
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides methods for opening/saving files in a window with the help of a file selection dialog.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

Method Detail

open

public static void open(Window win)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        UnsupportedException
Opens a file selection dialog and opens the selected file in a specified GOAL window.

Parameters:
win - a GOAL window
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if it failed to open the selected file due to IO failure
UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can encode the selected file

open

public static void open(Window win,
                        java.lang.String filename)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        UnsupportedException
Opens a file in a specified GOAL window.

Parameters:
win - a GOAL window
filename - the filename of the file to be opened
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if it failed to open the file due to IO failure
UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can encode the file content

open

public static void open(Window win,
                        java.io.File file)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        UnsupportedException
Opens a file in a specified GOAL window.

Parameters:
win - a GOAL window
file - the file to be opened
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if it failed to open file due to IO failure
UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can decode file

open

public static void open(Window win,
                        java.io.File file,
                        Codec codec)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        UnsupportedException
Opens a file in a specified GOAL window by a specified codec.

Parameters:
win - a GOAL window
file - the file to be opened
codec - the codec used to decode the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if it failed to open file due to IO failure
UnsupportedException - if the codec cannot decode file

openSelectionDialog

public static Pair<java.io.File[],Codec> openSelectionDialog(java.awt.Dialog owner,
                                                             boolean multi)
Opens a file selection dialog and returns the selected files and the selected codec.

Parameters:
owner - the owner of the file selection dialog
multi - indicates if multiple files can be selected
Returns:
the selected files and the selected codec (which may be null)

openSaveDialog

public static Pair<java.io.File,Codec> openSaveDialog(Tab tab,
                                                      Editable obj,
                                                      Codec codec)
                                               throws UnsupportedException
Opens a file saving dialog for saving an editable object in a specified tab.

Parameters:
tab - a tab containing obj in some GOAL window
obj - an editable object to be saved
codec - a suggested codec for encoding obj
Returns:
a pair of saved file and used codec
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tab is not in any GOAL window
UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can encode obj

openSaveDialog

public static Pair<java.io.File,Codec> openSaveDialog(Window owner,
                                                      Editable obj,
                                                      Codec prev_codec)
                                               throws UnsupportedException
Opens a file saving dialog for saving an editable object in a specified GOAL window.

Parameters:
owner - a GOAL window containing obj
obj - an editable object to be saved
prev_codec - a suggested codec for encoding obj
Returns:
a pair of saved file and used codec
Throws:
UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can encode obj
